bibl.title: Ferdinand Marino and Carolina B. Marino v. D. H. McCalla. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, Northern Divison

div1.ab: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
FERDINAND MARINO and CAROLINA BELUSCIA MARINO, his wife, Petitions, vs. D. H. McCALLA, Defendant.
div1.p: The petitioners for cause of action against the defendant, allege:

That they are, and for more than twenty years last past have been continuously, husband and wife. That they are the parents of Joseph Marino who was born to them as issue of their said marriage on to=wit: the 24th day of June, A. D. 1886; and at all times since the birth of said Joseph Marino have been, and now are, entitled to the custody and control of the said Joseph Marino.

That the defendant D. H. McCalla is an officer of the United States Navy, holding the rank of Captain therein, as your petitioners are informed and believe. That the said defendant by virtue of his rank and under the orderes of his superior officers, is now in the actual and active command of the United States battleship "Wisconsin", now lying off the United States Dry Dock of Bremerton, Kitsap County, Washington, within the jurisdiction of this court. That the said defendant D. H. McCalla as the captain and commander of the said battleship Wisconsin, unlawfully and by force detains in his custody on the said ship Wisconsin,

the said Joseph Marino, minor son of your petitioners; and the said Joseph Marino is now unlawfully and by force held and detained by the said defendant D. H. McCalla in his custody upon the said ship Wisconsin. That your petitioners are informed and believe that the said defendant D. H. McCalla claims the right and authority to detan the said Joseph Marino in his custody upon said ship Wisconsin by virtue of a pretended enlistment alleged by the said defendant D. H. McCalla to have been theretofore made by the said Joseph Marino in the navy of the United States, which pretended enlistment is claimed by the said defendant to have been made on or about the 4th day of December, 1901. That if the said Joseph Marino at the said date, or at any other date, attempted to enlist in the navy of the United States, said attempted enlistment was wholly without authority or consent of your petitioners, or either of them,; that your petitioners have not, and neither of them has, either orally or in writing, ever consented that the said Joseph Marino should enlist in the navy of the United States. That the enlistment claimed by the defendant to have been attempted to have been made by the said Joseph Marino in the navy of the United States was made, if at all, wholly against the will and without the authority or consent of your petitioners, or either of them.

WHEREFORE your petitioners pray that this honorable court will, by its write of habeas corpus directed to the said Captain D. H. McCalla, require the said D. H. McCalla to make return to the said writee as required by the statutes of the United States and the practice of this court, at a time and place to be named in and said writ; and further require the said D. H. McCalla at the time and place in said return, to produce before this court the body of the said Joseph Marino.
div1.ab: Preston, Carr & Gilman - Atty for Petitioners
DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, COUNTY OF KING.
div1.p: Carolina Beluscia Marino being first duly sworn upon her oath says: I am one of the petitioners named in the above and foregoing petition, being the mother of the Joseph Marino therein described. I have read the above and foregoing petition, know the contents thereof and the same are true.
div1.ab: Subscribed and sworn to before me this 31st day of December, A. D. 1902.
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle in said State.
div1.p: Let a writ of Habeas Corpus issue as prayed. Returnable before the Court at Seattle, at ten o'clock, A. M. on the 5th day of January 1902.
div1.ab: In the Circuit Court OF THE UNITED STATES District of Washington, Northern Division

Ferdinant Marino and Carolina B. Marino Petitioner
vs.
D. H. McCalla
Deft.
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus

FILED IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT, DIST. OF WASHINGTON.
DEC 31 1902
A. REEVES AYRES Clerk
PRESTON, CARR & GILMAN, Atty for Petitioner
Rooms 301 to 308 Pioneer Block Cor. First Ave, and James St. SEATTLE, WASHINGTON
